dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1935 IH: Protecting Military Assets Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Luttrell introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide that aliens who have been convicted of or who have committed an offense related to entering military, naval, or coast guard property, are inadmissible and deportable.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Military Assets Act of 2025.

section.header: Inadmissibility and deportability related to entering military, naval, or coast guard property

subsection.text: Section 212(a)(2) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1182(a)(2)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Entering military, naval, or coast guard property
subparagraph.text: Any alien who has been convicted of, who admits having committed, or who admits committing acts which constitute the essential elements of an offense under section 1382 of title 18, United States Code, is inadmissible.

subsection.text: Section 237(a)(2) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1227(a)(2)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Entering military, naval, or Coast Guard property
subparagraph.text: Any alien who has been convicted of an offense under section 1382 of title 18, United States Code, is deportable.
